children.name: sb who protects a person or place
keeper
children.definition: 1sb who looks after animals:
examples: a beekeeper
Bob is head lion keeper at the zoo.
2sb whose job is to look after a particular place or thing :
a lighthouse keeper
keeper of
the keeper of Greek coins in the British Museum

children.name: guard
children.definition: sb whose job is to watch a place, person, or valuable object, in order to protect them or stop them escaping: người bảo vệ , canh gác
examples: Guards at the embassy refused to let journalists enter.

children.name: security guardsb whose job is to guard a building : nhân viên bảo vệ
examples: Two men overpowered the security guard and stole $20,000.
There were twosecurity guardson duty outside the building.

children.name: armed guardone with a gun
examples: The captain put armed guards all around the camp.
Armed guardswere posted by the exit.

children.name: border/ prison guard
examples: Theprison guardswere reasonably friendly.
We were stopped byborder guards.

children.name: janitor
children.definition: US/caretakerUK sb whose job is to look after a building, especially a school: người trông nom

children.name: bodyguard
children.definition: a person or group of people whose job is to protectsomeoneimportant: vệ sĩ
examples: The President arrived, surrounded by bodyguards.

children.name: a member of the Emperor’s bodyguard
guardian
children.definition: defender/ a person or organization that protects, or appears to protect, sb/sth that people think is important or morally right: người bảo vệ, đội bảo vệ
examples: The group, known as the Defenders of Wildlife, have sued to protect the Louisiana black bear.
The film was banned as a result of protests by the Viewers Association and other so-called guardians of public morality.

children.name: minder
children.definition: British informal sb employed by a rich or famous person to protect him or her: cận vệ
examples: Kylie will often shop in Kensington without her minders, dressed in dark glasses for anonymity.

children.name: protection
children.definition: 1 when sb/sth is protected
examples: protection of
the protection of the environment
protection against/from
evidence that vitamin Cgives protectionagainst cancer
protection for
This lawprovides protectionfor threatened animals and plants.
for protection
The police were issued with body armour for extra protection.
2[C or U] sth that protects
as (a) protection (against sth)
Magee pulled up his collar as protection against the breeze.
data protectionsecurity issues such as data protection

children.name: give/provide protection
children.definition: alsooffer/afford protectionformal
examples: One dose of the vaccine provides protection against TB during childhood.|They say they are afforded no protection whatsoever by the security forces.

children.name: need protection
children.definition: alsorequire protectionformal
examples: He seemed to think that she needed protection.

children.name: seek protection
examples: They were forced to seek the protection of the army.

children.name: a degree/measure of protection
children.definition: some protection
examples: The shelter gave us a measure of protection against the bitter cold.

children.name: good protection
examples: This lightweight jacket gives good protection from the rain and wind.

children.name: adequate protection
examples: Some car seats for children did not provide adequate protection.

children.name: complete protection
examples: No security system can ever give complete protection against a determined thief.

children.name: greater/better protection
examples: The law should give greater protection to victims.

children.name: environmental protection
examples: A draft agreement on environmental protection for Antarctica was discussed.

children.name: consumer protection
examples: The consumer protection regulations will include new online shopping rules.

children.name: child protection
examples: Officers from the child protection team were called in after the girl turned to a neighbour for help.

children.name: police protection
children.definition: protection by the police
examples: He eventually managed to leave under heavy police protection.

children.name: protective
children.definition: protectiveclothes,covers, substances etcprotect sb/sth from being hurt or damaged: bảo vệ , bảo hộ, che chở
examples: Wear protective glasses when working with the saw.
Motorcyclists must wear protective helmets.
Remove the disk from its protective packaging.

children.name: protective gear/clothing
examples: Burke was not wearing protective gear when the accident happened.

children.name: shield
children.definition: sth that protects a person or thing from harm or damage: lá chắn, tấm chắn bảo vệ
examples: The spacecraft is covered in a material that acts as a heat shield.
Before operating this machine, make sure the safety shield is in place.

children.name: shield against
examples: The immune system is our body’s shield against infection.
Suncream acts as a kind of shield against the sun’s harmful ultraviolet rays.

children.name: guard
children.definition: sth that is, for example, fixed to a machine or worn on a part of your body, in order to provide protection against damage or injury – usually used in compound: tấm bảo vệ
examples: You can buy guards for electric sockets that make it impossible for little children to stick their fingers into the holes.
Football players are strongly advised to wear shin guards.
a fire guard
a trigger guard
The helmet has a face guard attached.

children.name: protector
children.definition: a piece of clothing or equipment that you wear or hold to protect a part of your body: vật bảo vệ, vật bảo hộ, vật che chở
examples: Hockey goalies wear a chest protector that is similar to the one a catcher in baseball wears.
A pocket protector will prevent ink staining your shirt.

children.name: safeguard
children.definition: sth, for example a law or rule, that provides protection against danger, problems, or failure: bảo vệ, che chở
examples: There’s a safeguard built into the tenancy agreement that says the landlord must give you three months’ notice to quit.
Anti-virus software is a simple safeguard that many computer users have not bothered to install.
International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.

children.name: safeguard against
examples: As a safeguard against misuse, memorize your PIN number immediately and destroy this advice slip.

children.name: safeguards against the exploitation of children
shelter
children.definition: a place where you will be protected from danger or from bad weather:

children.name: nơi nương tựa nương náu
examples: ▪ It began to rain and we all ran for shelter.

children.name: shelter of
examples: ▪ William hurried towards the shelter of the old cowshed.

children.name: take shelterfind a safe place
examples: ▪ People took shelter from the flooding in churches and schools on high ground.

children.name: bomb sheltera place, usually underground, that is safe from bombs : hầm tránh bom
examples: ▪ Underground stations in London were used as bomb shelters during the Second World War.

children.name: care
children.definition: the work or process of looking after something in order to keep it in good condition:
examples: sự chăm sóc
care of chăm sóc
▪ She has become a leading expert on the care and maintenance of Renaissance paintings.
▪ Care of the environment has become a priority in government thinking.
▪ These photocopiers require a little extra care to keep them running right.
hair-care/skin-care etc chăm sóc tóc, da
▪ hair-care products
▪ I’d advise you to follow a new skin care routine.
B2
carenounPROTECTION sự chăm sóc, sự chăm nom, sự giữ gìn, sự bảo dưỡng
[ U ] the process of protecting and looking after someone or something
_The standard of care at our local hospital is excellent.
_Mira's going to be very weak for a long time
after the operation, so she'll need a lot of care.
_Nurseries are responsible for the childrenintheir care.
B1
take care ofsb/sthchăm sóc; chăm nom
to look after someone or something
_Takegoodcare of that girl of yours, Patrick - she's very special.
_Don't worry about me, I can take care of myself
(= I do not need anyone else to protect me) .

children.name: security
children.definition: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime: an ninh

children.name: tight/strict
children.definition: good security, so that something is very safe
examples: The event passed off peacefully, amid tight security.

children.name: lax
children.definition: not good enough, so that something is not as safe as it should be
examples: The Prime Minister denied that border security had been lax.

children.name: heightened security
children.definition: more than usual
examples: There is heightened security around Heathrow following the bomb threats.

children.name: national/state security
children.definition: security of a country
examples: Did the article contain any information that is damaging to national security?

children.name: personal security
children.definition: security of an individual person
examples: The department is responsible for the President’s personal security.

children.name: improve/tighten security
children.definition: make it better
examples: Mexico has tightened security along its southern border.

children.name: the security services/forces
children.definition: the police, army etc
examples: Clashes with the security forces continued.

children.name: security measures/arrangements
examples: Residents have been warned to take extra security measures following a spate of burglaries.

children.name: a security check
examples: There are security checks at the entrance to the courtrooms.

children.name: a security guard
examples: There are armed security guards outside the palace.

children.name: security staff
examples: Teams of security staff guard the laboratory.

children.name: a security camera
examples: A car park security camera captured the attack.

children.name: a security system
children.definition: a system of cameras, alarms etc to provide security
examples: The first stage would be to install security systems and adequate lighting in churches.

children.name: a security risk
examples: His presence in the area posed a significant security risk.

children.name: for security reasons
examples: He can’t be identified for security reasons.

children.name: a breach of security
children.definition: when something happens that the security should have stopped
examples: There was a serious breach of security at the prison last Friday.

children.name: preservation
children.definition: when something is kept in its original state or in good condition: bảo tồn, bảo quản
examples: preservation of
Eliot campaigned for the preservation of London’s churches.
We are working for the preservation of the environment.
the preservation of our cultural heritage
methods of food preservation
The prime minister has said that the government is committed to the preservation (= protection)ofthe country's national interests.

children.name: precaution
children.definition: sth you do in order to prevent sth dangerous or unpleasant from happening: sự phòng ngừa, đề phòng
examples: Fire precautions were neglected.

children.name: take a precaution
examples: We had taken the precaution of turning the water off.

children.name: a sensible/wise precaution
examples: Fitting window locks is a sensible precaution.

children.name: a simple precaution
examples: You can easily reduce the risk of theft by taking a few simple precautions.

children.name: a necessary precaution
examples: He justified his secrecy as a necessary precaution.

children.name: a reasonable precaution
examples: You must take all reasonable precautions to safeguard official property.

children.name: adequate/proper precautions
examples: Companies have a legal responsibility to take adequate precautions against fire.

children.name: basic/elementary precautions
examples: Your home could be at risk if you don't take some basic precautions.

children.name: elaborate precautions
children.definition: a lot of detailed precautions
examples: Elaborate precautions were taken to avoid disputes between the representatives.

children.name: a safety precaution
examples: Both areas were cordoned off as a safety precaution.

children.name: a security precaution
examples: The threat of terrorist attacks has prompted some elaborate security precautions.

children.name: as a precaution
examples: The traffic barriers were put there as asafety precaution.

children.name: precaution against
examples: Save your work often as a precaution against computer failure.

children.name: wise/sensible precaution
examples: The trails are well marked, but carrying a map is a wise precaution.
Vetstook precautionsto prevent the spread of the disease.

children.name: take the precaution of doing something
examples: I took the precaution of insuring my camera.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually sayjust in caserather thanas a precaution:
I'm going to take my umbrellajust in case.

children.name: cover
children.definition: shelter or protection from bad weather orunpleasant situation

children.name: take cover
examples: We took cover from the storm in a bus shelter.
We were forced totake coverin a barn.

children.name: run/dive for cover
examples: He was shot in the head as he ran for cover.
Three soldiersbroke cover(= left the place where they were hiding ).

children.name: under cover
examples: The burglar broke into the houseundercover of darkness.
